      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      action - supports the following actions "copy", "paste", "cut", "select all", "unselect"

      sourceElementLocator - the locator of the source webElement that should be dragged under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)

    • dragAndDropByOffset

      public static void dragAndDropByOffset(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By sourceElementLocator, int xOffset, int yOffset)
      Drags the source element and drops it onto the determined offset
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      sourceElementLocator - the locator of the source webElement that should be dragged under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      xOffset - the horizontal offset by which the element should be moved
      yOffset - the vertical offset by which the element should be moved

    • executeNativeMobileCommand

      public static void executeNativeMobileCommand(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, String command, Map<String,String> parameters)
      This is a generic method to enable the execution of the native mobile commands found herein: http://appium.io/docs/en/commands/mobile-command/

      Note: This method does no validation on the output of the executed JavaScript

      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver, which should wrap around a native mobile object
      command - the desired mobile command to be executed. e.g., "mobile: scroll"
      parameters - a map of the key, value parameters for this command. e.g., ImmutableMap.of("direction", "down")

      public static String getAiReferenceFileName()

    • getAttribute

      public static String getAttribute(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator, String attributeName)
      Get the value of the given attribute of the element. Will return the current value, even if this has been modified after the page has been loaded.

      More exactly, this method will return the value of the property with the given name, if it exists. If it does not, then the value of the attribute with the given name is returned. If neither exists, null is returned.

      The "style" attribute is converted as best can be to a text representation with a trailing semicolon.

      The following are deemed to be "boolean" attributes, and will return either "true" or null:

      async, autofocus, autoplay, checked, compact, complete, controls, declare, defaultchecked, defaultselected, defer, disabled, draggable, ended, formnovalidate, hidden, indeterminate, iscontenteditable, ismap, itemscope, loop, multiple, muted, nohref, noresize, noshade, novalidate, nowrap, open, paused, pubdate, readonly, required, reversed, scoped, seamless, seeking, selected, truespeed, willvalidate

      Finally, the following commonly mis-capitalized attribute/property names are evaluated as expected:

      If the given name is "class", the "className" property is returned. If the given name is "readonly", the "readOnly" property is returned. Note: The reason for this behavior is that users frequently confuse attributes and properties. If you need to do something more precise, e.g., refer to an attribute even when a property of the same name exists, then you should evaluate Javascript to obtain the result you desire.

      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      attributeName - the target attribute of the webElement under test
      Returns:
      the value of the target attribute of the webElement under test

    • getCSSProperty

      public static String getCSSProperty(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator, String propertyName)
      Get the value of a given CSS property. Color values should be returned as RGBA strings, so, for example if the "background-color" property is set as "green" in the HTML source, the returned value will be "RGBA(0, 255, 0, 1)". Note that shorthand CSS properties (e.g. background, font, border, border-top, margin, margin-top, padding, padding-top, list-style, outline, pause, cue) are not returned, in accordance with the DOM CSS2 specification - you should directly access the longhand properties (e.g. background-color) to access the desired values.
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      propertyName - the target CSS property of the webElement under test
      Returns:
      the value of the target CSS property of the webElement under test

    • getContext

      public static String getContext(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver)
      Returns the handle for currently active context. This can be used to switch to this context at a later time.
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Appium Driver
      Returns:
      The current context handle

      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Appium Driver
      Returns:
      list of context handles

      Parameters:

      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      Returns:
      integer value that represents the number of elements that match the desired elementLocator

    • getElementsCount

      public static int getElementsCount(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator, int numberOfAttempts)
      Returns the number of elements that match a certain elementLocator
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      numberOfAttempts - the number of retries before returning a count [returns zero if no elements were found after all the retries]
      Returns:
      integer value that represents the number of elements that match the desired elementLocator

      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver

    • hoverAndClick

      Hovers over the hoverElements in sequence then clicks the clickableElement
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      hoverElementLocators - the list of locators of the webElements under test upon which the hover action will be performed in sequence (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      clickableElementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test upon which the click action will be performed (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)

    • performTouchAction

      public static TouchActions performTouchAction(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver)
      This is a convenience method to be able to call TouchActions Actions for touch-enabled devices from within the regular Element Actions Class.

      Sample use would look like this: ElementActions.performTouchAction().tap(driver, loginButton);

      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver, which should wrap around a native mobile object
      Returns:
      a TouchActions object capable of performing actions on touch-enabled devices

    • waitForTextToChange

      public static void waitForTextToChange(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator, String initialValue, int numberOfTries)
      Waits dynamically for a specific element's text to change from the initial value to a new unknown value. Waits for a specific number of retries multiplied by the default element identification timeout (in the POM.xml file)
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      initialValue - the initial text value of the target webElement
      numberOfTries - the number of times to try and wait for the element text to change (default is 1)

    • select

      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      text - the text of the choice that you need to select from the target dropDown menu

    • switchToDefaultContent

      public static WebDriverElementActions switchToDefaultContent()
      Switches focus to default content, is mainly used in coordination with switchToIframe(WebDriver, By) to exit any iFrame layer and go back to the main page
      Returns:
      a self-reference to be used to chain actions

    • switchToIframe

      public static void switchToIframe(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator)
      Switches focus to a certain iFrame, is mainly used in coordination with switchToDefaultContent(WebDriver) to navigate inside any iFrame layer and go back to the main page
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the iFrame webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)

    • switchToWindow

      public static void switchToWindow(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, String nameOrHandle)
      Switches focus to another window
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      nameOrHandle - The name of the window or the handle as returned by ElementActions.getWindowHandle(WebDriver driver)

    • type

      public static void type(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator, String text)
      Checks if there is any text in an element, clears it, then types the required string into the target element.
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      text - the target text that needs to be typed into the target webElement

    • typeAppend

      public static void typeAppend(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator, String text)
      Appends the required string into the target element, regardless of the current text value.
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      text - the target text that needs to be appended into the target webElement

    • typeFileLocationForUpload

      public static void typeFileLocationForUpload(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator, String absoluteFilePath)
      ValidationEnums the required file path into an input[type='file'] button, to successfully upload the target file.
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      absoluteFilePath - the full path to the file that needs to be uploaded

    • typeSecure

      public static void typeSecure(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator, String text)
      Checks if there is any text in an element, clears it, then types the required string into the target element. Obfuscates the written text in the output report. This action should be used for writing passwords and secure text.
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      text - the target text that needs to be typed into the target webElement

    • waitForElementToBePresent

      public static void waitForElementToBePresent(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator, int numberOfTries, boolean stateOfPresence)
      Waits dynamically for a specific element to achieve the desired stateOfPresence on the current page. Waits for a specific number of retries multiplied by the default element identification timeout (in the POM.xml file)
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      numberOfTries - the number of times to try and wait for the element to achieve the desired stateOfPresence (default is 1)
      stateOfPresence - the expected state of presence of the element; false is not present, and true is present
